Hi,

I guess I found the solution myself. I configured the budgeting so tha=
t I use the UnitCostAssignmentPolicy, hold-queues=3Dtrue and set the total-=
budget to the value I previously tried to set with a quota-enforcer.

Curre=
nty the crawl seems to run fine and there a no unexpected retired queues.

=
Cheers,
Tino

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "t.schoellhorn" <t.sc=
hoellhorn@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> I am using H3 and currenty I am struggli=
ng with a crawl which doesn't get completed as I'd like it to complete. The=
 crawl gets paused with a lot of retired queues which don't get crawled. 
>=
 
> As far as I understand retirement is a feature which has to do with the=
 general crawl-policy when each domain/queue gets crawled. 
> 
> To disable=
 the budget-feature I already enable the ZeroCostAssignmentPolicy and set "=
hold-queues" of the frontier to "false". I thought that this way no retirem=
ent happens. But so far, the retirement still happens.
> 
> Do you have any=
 hints or ideas how I could disable this retirement behaviour? Or how I cou=
ld reactivate those retired queues? I'd prefer the first variant so my craw=
ls get crawled completeley. 
> 
> Cheers,
> Tino
>
